meanings.definition: A person or thing that brings about a result or change.
meanings.sent1: The effecter of the experiment was the new fertilizer.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the effecter of positive change in the students' behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous effecter of chaos turned out to be a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the effecter of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The effecter of the decision was evident in the improved sales numbers.

meanings.sent1: She hoped to effecter a positive change in the community.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to effecter their goal of winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to effecter a rabbit out of the hat but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His speech was able to effecter a sense of unity among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The rain effectered a sense of calm over the garden.
